ressources

Class TwitterBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • ressources.TwitterBuilder

  • public class TwitterBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    Wrapper for tweets whose aim is to query twitter api and create tweets instances and then push them into the database

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TwitterBuilder()
      Twitter Builder Constructor, it gets the tokens for the Twitter API from a local file

    • Method Summary

      Get the values, parse them into correct the cast and build the Tweet objects
      java.util.List<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>> getValues(org.json.JSONArray arr, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> path_list)
      For every path from the Objects we retrieve the values corresponding to those objects
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args) 
      java.util.List<Tweet> queryAndCreate(java.lang.String url, org.hibernate.Session session)
      Top level function, using the provided url to create the list of Tweets that will be send to the frontend
      void recurs_parsingJSON(org.json.JSONObject obj, org.json.JSONArray arr, java.lang.String previous_key, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> all_path)
      Get the JSON Objects from the Twitter API request statuses and recursively get the path for every leaves of the object, for example background_color of the user will be in statuses.user.background_color
      org.json.JSONObject request(java.lang.String url)
      Function that ask twitter REST API for a specific query by using HTTP and putting the response inside a JSON Object

                                                                                  org.json.JSONException
        For every path from the Objects we retrieve the values corresponding to those objects
        Parameters:

        path_list - Path of the leaves from the JSON Objects

      • recurs_parsingJSON

        public void recurs_parsingJSON(org.json.JSONObject obj,
                               org.json.JSONArray arr,
                               java.lang.String previous_key,
                               java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> all_path)
                        throws org.json.JSONException
        Get the JSON Objects from the Twitter API request statuses and recursively get the path for every leaves of the object, for example background_color of the user will be in statuses.user.background_color
        Parameters:
        obj - JSON Objects that will be parsed
        arr - JSON Array that will be parsed
        previous_key - String containing the parents of the current object
        all_path - Array of String containing all the path for every leaves
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException

        Parameters:

        session - Hibernate Session
        Returns:
        List of Objects Tweet
